page.title: 03STAINLAND VILLAGE
page.content: There are only eight shops in the village, a butcher, two general stores, a baker, a chemist, a post office, a hairdresser and a tile and kitchen centre, so when the villagers want to do a large amount of shopping they usually travel to Halifax or Huddersfield. There are plenty of pubs The Duke of York, The Red Lion, The Bull and Dog and The Rose and Crown. If anyone's car breaks down it can be repaired at the Black Horse Garage. The village school was built in 1882, and there are now approximately 180 children attending it.This is what some of them think about Stainland. "I think it is a friendly place. It is very cold in winter." (Cathie Holden). "I think Stainland is a nice place to live, but sometimes it smells because of the muck spreading." (Melanie Tetlaw).
